tags: in my defense. if they'd started watching when I first told them about it they'd be nearly caught up by now
summary: A Friend: Hey, have you guys watched ‘x’ show yet? Other Friends: No. All we have watched. For a month. Is Critical Role. That’s...
body:
A Friend: Hey, have you guys watched ‘x’ show yet?
Other Friends: No. All we have watched. For a month. Is Critical Role. That’s it. We’ve not watched anything else at all, we have just been watching Critical Role. Every. Day.
Me, who is responsible for this: I’m so sorry.
Everyone else: …..
Me: Yeah that even sounded disingenuous to me. I’m not sorry at all.

reblog.comment:

Me, who is responsible for this: I’m so sorry.
Everyone else: …..
Me: Yeah that even sounded disingenuous to me. I’m not sorry at all.

Everyone else: …..
Me: Yeah that even sounded disingenuous to me. I’m not sorry at all.
trail.content:
A Friend: Hey, have you guys watched ‘x’ show yet?
Other Friends: No. All we have watched. For a month. Is Critical Role. That’s it. We’ve not watched anything else at all, we have just been watching Critical Role. Every. Day.
Me, who is responsible for this: I’m so sorry.
Everyone else: …..
Me: Yeah that even sounded disingenuous to me. I’m not sorry at all.

summary: I love reading all the posts from Critters who watched Search for Grog and didn’t watch campaign 1 and are like “wait Gilmore is...
body:
I love reading all the posts from Critters who watched Search for Grog and didn’t watch campaign 1 and are like “wait Gilmore is gay?” (yes he is and he is a hero). So I thought I would help by highlighting some of the other great NPCs Matthew Mercer has gifted us with over campaign 1 (in no particular order and not an exhaustive list since I’m trying to avoid spoilers):

Lady Kima of Vord, halfling paladin of Bahamut, smol but she will kick your ass

Victor the Black Powder Merchant

Senokir, the Genasi jeweler with a creepy voice

J’mon sa Ord

Tyriok Gadsworth (the mapmaker) who has had a very hard life

tags: i’m genuinely trying to emulate him
a lot about him was admirable
summary: honestly? real talk hour? mollymauk is the epitome of good character creation. not only does he have a defining mantra — live...
body:
honestly? real talk hour? mollymauk is the epitome of good character creation. not only does he have a defining mantra — live life as much as he can, because he doesn’t know how much life he has left — but it’s a relatable one.

and it was one i needed to hear.

sure, there are tons of gold-leaf curlicued little boards with “life is short!” and “carpe diem!!” written in cursive, but there’s nothing quite so resonant as walking into an establishment and going surprise me. as recognizing that there is fun to be had — and good to be done — everywhere.

i didn’t like mollymauk much when he was first introduced. i didn’t understand him. he seemed shallow and stubborn. and then he told us a story about coughing up out of the dirt less than two years ago, and befriending a giant woman who cradles flowers like precious things, and then i connected to him, and then he died.

anyway, there’s no central thesis to this post. just that mollymauk is a wonderful character whose story encapsulates a powerful mindset that i am now trying to emulate in my own life. because we really only get so many days, and we really only get so many minutes, and each one can be an opportunity — to surprise ourselves, to learn, to do good, recklessly — if we see them as they are.

Critical Role, TAZ, actual play, this game is such a wonderful thing that brings people of all shapes and sizes and colors together and it is beautiful. I am also a lowkey cosplayer and overall loving person. You will find almost everything and anything on this blog, so please enjoy all the loves of my life with me ❤❤❤

summary: The cast of Critical Role is appearing at Denver Pop Culture Con 2019! Meet, get autographs, selfies, or professional photo ops....
caption:
The cast of Critical Role is appearing at Denver Pop Culture Con 2019! Meet, get autographs, selfies, or professional photo ops. They’ll do their group panel (open to all congoers) on Saturday, but they’re also appearing and doing lots of other things on Sunday, too. AND all of the cast will pre-sell autographs and photo ops beginning April 2. You’ll find all of those links on our Critical Role landing page linked below!

Buy Tickets: https://denverpopculturecon.com/tickets/

Learn More: https://denverpopculturecon.com/awesomeness/critical-role/

summary: it’s tuesday! and everybody knows trans people legally own tuesdays
body:
it’s tuesday! and everybody knows trans people legally own tuesdays

so come join me for this installment of

Trans Tuesday!

aka an all-day fanart dump celebrating the trans and nonbinary characters / headcanons from some good good shows (mostly TAZ and CR, but i’ve sprinkled a few other things in there.)

trans people are amazing and delightful and made of magic, and that’s just the way it is.

also! please send me your trans hcs! tag me in your trans character art (if it’s accessible, even better)! tell me how happy you are to be trans! there’s only one rule, and that’s gender euphoria, babey. 

okay i love you!

summary: I currently have a playlist of songs I'd like to make animations for when/if we get closure in certain plot threads and it's...
body:
I currently have a playlist of songs I’d like to make animations for when/if we get closure in certain plot threads and it’s looking like I might actually get to start on Notts soon enough

No I Won’t Go- Brick + Mortar (no surprise there) for when we find out Yezas reaction to Nott and what she plans to do next

No Culture- Mother Mother, When we get some closure on Molly

Friends- Brick + Mortar (look…), When we meet Astrid and Eodwulf

Willow Tree March- Paper Kites, Caduceus has a family out there somewhere, or does he?

Brighter Than The Sun- Brick +Mortar (they’re my favorite ok?), Yasha, Zuala, The Storm, The Flowers

Train- Brick + Mortar (🤷🏻‍♂️), Beau is going to confront her family eventually, and TMN are going to get her there

There’s also Hollow Tune, Move To The Ocean, and If This Tour Doesnt Kill You, I Will, which just have a MN feel, and Turn the Lights Off, which shork did already

There’s also Hollow Tune, Move To The Ocean, and If This Tour Doesnt Kill You, I Will, which just have a MN feel, and Turn the Lights Off, which shork did already

trail.content_raw:
I currently have a playlist of songs I’d like to make animations for when/if we get closure in certain plot threads and it’s looking like I might actually get to start on Notts soon enough

No I Won’t Go- Brick + Mortar (no surprise there) for when we find out Yezas reaction to Nott and what she plans to do next

No Culture- Mother Mother, When we get some closure on Molly

Friends- Brick + Mortar (look…), When we meet Astrid and Eodwulf

Willow Tree March- Paper Kites, Caduceus has a family out there somewhere, or does he?

Brighter Than The Sun- Brick +Mortar (they’re my favorite ok?), Yasha, Zuala, The Storm, The Flowers

Train- Brick + Mortar (🤷🏻‍♂️), Beau is going to confront her family eventually, and TMN are going to get her there

There’s also Hollow Tune, Move To The Ocean, and If This Tour Doesnt Kill You, I Will, which just have a MN feel, and Turn the Lights Off, which shork did already
